image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives

profileText: A Representative from Florida; born in Binghamton, Broome County, N.Y., February 4, 1944; attended Horace Mann School, Binghamton, N.Y., 1950; graduated, Miami Edison High School, Fla., 1961; attended the University of Florida, Gainesville, 1961; B.A., Florida Atlantic University, Boca Raton, 1966; teacher, Palm Beach, Fla., and Montgomery County, Md., 1966-1968; administrative assistant to Rep. Paul G. Rogers, 1968-1978; elected as a Democrat to the Ninety-sixth and to the four succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1979-January 3, 1989); was not a candidate for reelection in 1988 but was an unsuccessful candidate for nomination to the United States Senate; is a resident of West Palm Beach, Fla.

researchRecord.name: 1986-1988, 13 commercials on 2 videocassettes.
researchRecord.description: The commercials used during Daniel Mica's campaigns for the 1986 U.S. congressional election in District 14 and the 1988 U.S. senatorial election in Florida, Democratic Party.

recordLocation.name: The Julian P. Kanter Political Commercial Archive, Department of Communication
